result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jorge Ernesto Ruiz

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Defendant's Motion To Suppress Stop

Defendant Jorge Ernesto Ruiz in court.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy in court for Jorge Ernesto Ruiz.  Attorney Gerald Alder in court for State of Wisconsin on behalf of Attorney James C Griffin.

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense requests motion to suppress hearing.  Court ordered Defense to file motion documents by November 4, 2022.  Defendant's other case 21CF2174 and all TR matters will track along this case.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report Report 10-06-2022
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Status Report 9.19.22
Pretrial Services Status Report

Defendant Jorge Ernesto Ruiz in court with attorney Nicholas John Conrardy.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report
Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense
Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense

Defendant Jorge Ernesto Ruiz in court with attorney Nicholas John Conrardy.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting another status date. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report

Defendant Jorge Ernesto Ruiz in court, appear by video with attorney Nicholas John Conrardy, appear by video.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02. Court inform defendant with conditions of bail.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report

Defendant Jorge Ernesto Ruiz in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel. Court appoints attorney Nicholas Conrardy to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The Court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning the 1st of the month after the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Case adjourned for preliminary hearing, Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report

Defendant Jorge Ernesto Ruiz in court appeared by video.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for preliminary hearing. State witness present.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report

22RM023992  Actual Date Bond Posted with * Sheriff
5/3/2022

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision Level 4.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.  Scram bracelet ordered to monitor defendant maintains absolute sobriety.

Defendant Jorge Ernesto Ruiz in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Defendant Jorge Ernesto Ruiz in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jorge Ernesto Ruiz appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has lower number case(s) pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
